intro: Actinostemon oligandrus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved actinostemon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Actinostemon oligandrus is often found in shrubland or fynbos vegetation, thriving in well-drained, sunny conditions.
